    • Method Detail

      • playerConnected

        protected void playerConnected(int playerID)
        When the players connects, this method starts the game by sending the initial game state. At this time, the players' hands are null. The hands will be set when the first hand is dealt.
        Overrides:
        playerConnected in class netgame.common.Hub
        Parameters:
        playerID - playerID

      • playerDisconnected

        protected void playerDisconnected(int playerID)
        If a player disconnects, the game ends. This method shuts down the Hub, which will send a signal to the remaining connected player, if any, to let them know that their opponent has left the game. The client will respond by terminating that player's program.
        Overrides:
        playerDisconnected in class netgame.common.Hub
        Parameters:
        playerID - playerID

      • everyoneHasBet

        private boolean everyoneHasBet()
        checks to see if everyone has bet
        Returns:
        if everyone has bet.

      • messageReceived

        protected void messageReceived(int playerID,
                   java.lang.Object message)
        This is the method that responds to messages received from the clients. It handles all of the action of the game. When a message is received, this method will make any changes to the state of the game that are triggered by the message. It will then send information about the new state to each player, and it will generally send a string to each client as a message to be displayed to that player.
        Overrides:
        messageReceived in class netgame.common.Hub
        Parameters:
        playerID - playerID
        message - message that the player sends

      • isEveryoneDone

        private boolean isEveryoneDone()
        Checks to see if the round is over.
        Returns:
        true or false

        Moves to the next open player.

      • changeBackToPlayerOne

        private void changeBackToPlayerOne()
        Changes back to player 1 for the next round.

      • roundOver

        private void roundOver()
        This method is called when the game ends and there is a winner. It gives the pot to the winner, sends each player a message about the outcome of the game, changes the state to get ready for the next game, and sends a state message to each player.

      • changeToArray

        private Card[] changeToArray(Hand h)
        Changes a hand to an array.
        Parameters:
        h - Hand
        Returns:
        changes to array

      • sendToOthers

        private void sendToOthers(int currentPlayerID,
                java.lang.Object message)
        This method is used by messageReceived() to send state messages to the rest of the players.
        Parameters:
        currentPlayerID - The state of the player who makes the next move. One of the status values from the PokerGameState class.
        message - The state of the opposing player. One of the status values from the PokerGameState class.

      • sendBettingState

        private void sendBettingState()
        This method is used by messageReceived() to send state messages to both players.
        Parameters:
        currentPlayerState - The state of the player who makes the next move. One of the status values from the PokerGameState class.
        opponentState - The state of the opposing player. One of the status values from the PokerGameState class.

      • sendState

        private void sendState(int currentPlayerState)
        This method is used by messageReceived() to send state messages to both players.
        Parameters:
        currentPlayerState - The state of the player who makes the next move. One of the status values from the PokerGameState class.
        opponentState - The state of the opposing player. One of the status values from the PokerGameState class.
